meanings.definition: A strip of material used to bind or cover a wound.
meanings.sent1: I put a bandage on my cut finger.
meanings.sent2: The nurse wrapped a bandage around the injured arm.
meanings.sent3: The bandage felt like a soft hug on the wound.
meanings.sent4: Her words were a bandage to his broken heart.
meanings.sent5: The bright bandage stood out against the dark skin.

meanings.definition: To apply a bandage to a wound.
meanings.sent1: She carefully bandaged the scrape on her knee.
meanings.sent2: The doctor will bandage your arm after the injection.
meanings.sent3: He tried to bandage the situation, but it only made things worse.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness bandaged his emotional wounds.
meanings.sent5: The bandage tightly wrapped around the wound, protecting it.
